reviews.title: Nightmare in the Am Schubertring: January 2005
reviews.text: Last winter I stayed at this Hotel as a special treat, spending more than I usually would but I wanted four star comfort and Vienna is an expensive city. The Hotel was neither wonderful nor terrible – a little characterless for the cost, but not overpriced for Vienna. It was clean, good breakfast, sizeable rooms, and excellent location. If nothing had happened I would not be posting this.

reviews.title: Great Place, Excellent service, Comfortable rooms
reviews.text: Unfortunately my wife had jewellery stolen from our room. It was the manner in which the staff and eventually the manager handled this which leads me to this review. Firstly, when we discovered our loss the one person on desk duty was extremely unhelpful in advising us. He did call the police but when we told him we had the dilemma that if we were to have to wait for them for long we would have the additional loss of missing our concert that night, he refused to call the police to find out if we could arrange a time or if they could let us know what we could do in the situation. (Nothing maybe, but the courtesy was missing). Throughout, he showed no sympathy for what had happened, or surprise – he seemed only defensive and wishing he didn’t have the responsibility to deal with the situation.

The following day not one of the hotel staff acknowledged us in the morning and seemed very uncomfortable when we addressed them, and we received no contact from the management to discuss what had happened, neither simply to reassure us that they would do everything they could to help, nor to show their concern at the serious breach of security. (Only the room cleaner spoke to us about it – expressing her astonishment at what had happened.)
reviews.title: Good Location, Comfortable Rooms, Good Service

reviews.text: Eventually, I asked to speak to the hotel manager, who phoned me in the room three hours later. She showed no concern about the security breach, was openly unsympathetic to us and eventually told me that she didn’t believe us. As I was pointing out to her that this was no way for a four star hotel to behave she hung up. Her self-denial explains why we, as victims of a crime, were treated as pariahs, and suggests to me why such a security breach could occur. My advice, don’t risk it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and good value...

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here early September, the service was excellent, very friendly and welcoming, nothing too much trouble. The staff will assist in any directions, booking of concerts etc, although the location is across the road from all attractions, very central, yet very quiet. The rooms were a good size and nicely decorated, comfortable. The corridors to the rooms are querky and obviously due to the central atrium. Would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone, business, families, couples. When I visit Vienna again, I shall definitely stay here!
reviews.title: Great place to stay....will definitely stay again!

reviews.text: Great location right on one of the major loops around the city. There's a grocery store in the mall a few blocks down. Great shopping all around, the opera house is 3-4 blocks. We walked almost everywhere, also there's a metro stop 2 blocks away. TGIFridays restaurant 30 feet from the front door of the hotel for when you want a burger or some other american dish. The rooms are pretty spacious, having a kitchen (stove,frig) a couch and coffee table. the cieling is rather low on one side as you are on the top floor and have to contend with the angle of the roof. Managers were very helpful, breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Great Location/service
Perfect hotel for seeing Vienna
reviews.text: Great hotel. Rooms good & comfortable. The location was perfect - only a few hundred metres from the opera House. From here you could walk almost everywhere. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.
Breakfast was good (contiental). Would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Review of Am Schubertring

reviews.text: Everything in Vienna is expensive and I would not consider Vienna for a "value" vacation. In a city of expensive hotels this is a gem. The location can't be beat and the rooms are quite large, including bathrooms, for european hotels. We found the staff to be friendly, especially the breakfast staff.
reviews.title: Location, Comfort, Quality

reviews.text: After reading the review of the stolen jewelry we were diligent about the use of the safe. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to spend under $200 a night in Vienna.
reviews.title: Good hotel for the money
excellent location, lovely hotel....
reviews.text: Have only ever "used" reviews on this site and never posted one, so I can only help this is as helpful as the ones I've previously read. Loved this hotel, superb location (so near Statsoper and the Hotel Imperial) as well as helpful staff and yummy breakfast. My friend and I spent the last week of Jan 05 at the Hotel Am Schubertring and were delighted with our proximity to all things interesting to visitors to Vienna -- from cathedrals to museums to palaces and more. Also lovely that the tram stops were literally outside our front door as it was very (read: blowing) snowy a day or two during our week. The room (very in the back, charming, quiet except for the 71 tram which we came to love as it took us to both Belvedere Palace and to the Rennweg S7 station for the cheap ride back to the Vienna Airport) couldn't have been more lovely. Small sitting area, very spacious, Zimmer 26. We got a great air/land package so don't know how reasonable this hotel might be in the warmer season...Can't recommend this hotel enough, however. Staff helpful, helped us with our German and pointed us in the right direction (tram number wise, etc.) more than once. We were on our own, however, making dinner and tour reservations. Salzburg via West Bahnhof easy day-trip. Make sure to look into standing room only tickets to Statsoper performances (3.5 Euros day of perf.) . We got to see the Marriage of Figaro and it was outstanding, truly a highlight. Please please don't bother with the Albertina Museum, total waste of time and money due to horribly boring rotation of material, don't miss Schonnbrunn, Lipazzaners (if only a stable tour, like ours), tour of Imperial Treasury and whatever you can fit it otherwise. Drink lots of good coffee and reisling, as well! Guht Fahrt!!!!!
